item.title: The "Illegal start of expression" error explained
item.dc:creator: @ShadowShaft ShadowShaft
item.description:
@ShadowShaft wrote:

For every { you see you count 1 up! for every } you see you do minus 1 The outcome number is the how many brackets you need to put at the bottom

LoveNerd go backto congo & learn something please.

item.title: The "Illegal start of expression" error explained
item.dc:creator: @ShadowShaft ShadowShaft
item.description:
@ShadowShaft wrote:

Ok this is how it works. All the noobs saying add a } well thats correct but now you will be learning something

For every void or statement we got a open bracket {
If its open you need to close it to thats what you guys are forgetting so this example

public void lol() {1
if(LovescapeIsANerd) {2
setAnimation(1337);
1} else {2
sendmessage(“Yo dawg”);
}
}

Now it will be explained! the numbers are the } at the end

Thats why the lol() {
has a clossing at
} else {
else has another open one
so we need to close it at the bottom

For every { you see you count 1 up! for every } you see you do minus 1
The outcome number is the how many brackets you need to put at the bottom

Read full topic
item.source: The "Illegal start of expression" error explained
